channel.title: Help
channel.description: i honestly don't have any idea where this goes but anyways how do i make a model look 3d every time i make one its flat and i can't find a tutorial on making it 3d and i can't even watch CJ's tuts because every time i go to watch a video the video just flickers like the image goes in then out then in then out so please can someone make a picture/written tut on making an object look none flat

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @frogtamer101 frogtamer101
item.description:
@frogtamer101 wrote:

You could use primitives and model from that or just use different depths of your dots and lines.
Like say I’m making a bade and I make the sharp part that comes to a point all the way around to the point. I’d make it and keep it there. Now Ill go to the part that’s flat on the swords blade and take all those lins/dots and move them up and then create the faces. Make the blades edge lighter and the flat part darker and there you go then mirror it and do the same

Hope that helped

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Either Mirror it or Use Create to make it from Scratch.

Read full topic
